Articles.Content: I was on my way back to Kerbin from a interplanetary mission, and when i was aerobraking i saw this on the ground. I have seen it many times before but i never flew to one. If you dont know what im talking about but its the black spot. Im thinking its a volcano, but i cant be for sure until i go their.[ATTACH=CONFIG]32465[/ATTACH][ATTACH=CONFIG]32466[/ATTACH]
i am not sure but i think that might be one of the monliths on kerbin, i think that is what it is i am not sure
Ooh, a challenge! I actually have seen it quite a few times and keep forgetting to check it out.
It's a texture bug with Kerbin, nothing special.

It's a texture bug with Kerbin, nothing special.

sometimes we like having conspiracy's

guess ill have to return my tin foil...

i am not sure but i think that might be one of the monliths on kerbin, i think that is what it is i am not sure

No the monolith on Kerbin is at KSC2
Ive been there once. Its really just like it looks from orbit: Black terrain. Just like the texture fades from grass to sandy near water it just fades to black there...

No the monolith on Kerbin is at KSC2

There are five Monoliths on Kerbin that I know of. There's one within a few kilometers of KSC. Can't pick out the black spot in the OP image though. Picture's too dark for me.

It's a texture bug with Kerbin, nothing special.

NovaSilisko, is part of the official over up.

They don't want you to know the truth, one of the Monoliths detonated in that spot.

The Kerbals in that area were not living up to the Monolith Builders expectations and were culled from the planet.
